g.text: . It has been emphasized in earlier reviews
their device potential, it is important to obtain a deeper understanding of the molecular
interactions that underlie their ferroelectric and ferro(antiferro)magnetic phase transitions. In
this regard, it is known that for these MOFs, the motional dynamics of the A
play a pivotal role in driving the structural, ferroelectric transition
molecular unit, which possesses an axis of three-fold symmetry,
appears to be dynamically disordered over three possible orientations
coincides with the loss of this three-fold symmetry, as suggested by X-ray diffraction
none of these techniques has provided a quantitative estimate of the correlation time or
frequency of motion of the DMA
cation, a much sought-after datum in the phase transition
This report presents a variable frequency EPR study aimed at measuring the timescale of
, henceforth referred to as DMAZnF. This sample was chosen because
DMAZnF was the first compound shown to exhibit a dielectric
transition. It has now been confirmed to be a ferroelectric below the dielectric phase
DMAZnF displays a first-order structural phase transition at about T
diffraction reveals that at high temperature (HT), the compound exists in the trigonal R3c phase
while at low temperature (LT), its structure belongs to the monoclinic noncentrosymmetric Cc
. Despite this structural phase transition, the global structure does not change
significantly. Figure 1 shows the crystal structure of DMAZnF in the HT phase. The
ions are connected through the formate groups,
